channel.title: [Delta] Emotes Error [Delta]
channel.description:
I added a Better Emotes System tutorial and I got this error: [code]EmoteHandler.java:12: error: <identifier> expected private final client; ^ EmoteHandler.java:14: error: <identifier> expected public EmoteHandler(client) { ^ EmoteHandler.java:105: error: <identifier> expected public static void doSkillcapeEmote(client) { ^ 3 errors Finished! Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
I don't know what they mean by this. I don't know how to fix it. :/

item.title: [Delta] Emotes Error [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @gangsta_tony gangsta tony
item.description:
@gangsta_tony wrote:

[quote=“silabgarza, post:2, topic:447190”]should be (client c) {
so change these lines

Now I got this error:

EmoteHandler.java:12: error: cannot find symbol private final client c; ^ symbol: class client location: class EmoteHandler EmoteHandler.java:14: error: cannot find symbol public EmoteHandler(client c) { ^ symbol: class client location: class EmoteHandler EmoteHandler.java:105: error: cannot find symbol public static void doSkillcapeEmote(client c) { ^ symbol: class client location: class EmoteHandler clickingMost.java:219: error: cannot find symbol c.getEmoteHandler().startEmote(actionButtonId); ^ symbol: variable actionButtonId location: class clickingMost Note: EconomyReset.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 4 errors Finished! Press any key to continue . . .

Edit: I get this error when I don’t add the “c” to private final client; but I get 4 errors if I add the “c”

EmoteHandler.java:12: error: <identifier> expected private final client; ^ 1 error Finished! Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic
